de.cocolab.reuse
Class Position

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--de.cocolab.reuse.Position
public class Position
extends java.lang.Object
implements Comparable, HasPosition, java.io.Serializable

Representation of positions consisting of line and column numbers.

Other ways of defining the origin of parsed tokens should be implemented by subclassing this class. For example you may require to store a file name as well as line and column.

When inheriting from this class be sure to provide a sensible implementation of compareTo(Object) if you wish to use the 'store' facility of Errors.

Version:
$Id: Position.java,v 1.1.1.6 1999/06/22 18:00:28 howie Exp $

Method Detail

compareTo

public int compareTo(java.lang.Object other)
Compare with another position.

Return -1 if Position1 < Position2.
Return 0 if Position1 = Position2.
Return 1 if Position1 > Position2.
Comparison is in the sense of textual ordering: does this position occur earlier in the input than the other position?

Specified by:
compareTo in interface Comparable
Throws:
ClassCastException - if the specified object's type is not Position.

position

public Position position()
Return the source position of this object.

Specified by:
position in interface HasPosition
Returns:
this. This may seem a bit pointless, but consider the rex scanner code. All tokens have to have a ScanAttribute which at least defines the original source code position of the token for use in diagnostic messages. Some tokens have additional information, for example literals also have a value. Having Position support HasPosition lets us use Position directly for tokens such as punctuation which normally have no other attributes. Otherwise we would have to wrap the position in yet another object.
